intro: Cacalia berlandieri, commonly known as the Mexican blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sun, making it well adapted to arid environments. Its blue to purple flowers bloom in the spring and attract various pollinators, including bees and butterflies. Cacalia berlandieri is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
